review_title: Great Company and Great Team Members
job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Delta, CO
pros: I don't think I have ever worked somewhere that I genuinely enjoyed interacting with everyone I meet like here. I love getting to support people who make a real difference in the community, and I feel like everyone really cares about each other.
cons: I wish we had some sort of continuing education benefits but other than that I can't think of any real negatives.

pros:
One of the first things I noticed when I started working here was the warmth, friendliness, and overall desire to make you feel welcome and part of the community. People make an effort to get to know you, they check-up on you and show genuine interest and concern. Overall, the company culture is one of the best things about DCMH and is one of the reasons why they have such a high number of employees that have worked here for 5 years, 15 years, 25 years, etc. 

There is a high level of respect for admin and management, but they don't make you feel a strong sense of hierarchy. Everyone is treated equally. Our CEO will often stop by your office to say hello, and the rest of the C-suite makes a genuine effort to connect with you and to know you. 

The experience I've had in my department specifically has been one of the best jobs I have had. My boss is diligent, thoughtful, communicative, and understanding. Our department works as a team that balances and respects each other. It really is a great place to work. The beautiful view of the Mesa is a plus, too!
cons: I really haven't experienced anything highly negative while working at DCMH.

review_title: One of the worst experiences of my career
pros: The staff initially was welcoming and was a nice hospital and the administration was welcoming when I first started
cons: But the orientation was a nightmare.  Some of the staff was rude and not helpful, especially the supervisors and department manager.  There was no feedback nor if I did something wrong, it was not given to me.  My manager only left me some text messages and maybe an e-mail.  When I went in to HR to sign up for benefits after my 90 day probation period, the terminated me saying how I wasn't going to work out for them and they couldn't talk to me because I lived 20 miles away.  I was in 30 minutes prior to my shift and would have made the trip in if they called me, but never did.  They had nothing in writing for me or and specific problems.  Note, I was signing up for healthcare benefits, so how convenient for them to let me go at that time.  So I didn't even had a chance at COBBRA or anything.  Now I have a black mark on my record because they can now trash me while trying to find another job just so they can save some money.  My job was never filled after I left.
